total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern of transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is always a 3x5 grid, regardless of the size of the input grid.
Q3: Identify the role of the number 9 in the input grid. It seems to be replaced by the number 6 in the output grid.
Q4: Identify the role of the number 4 in the input grid. It seems to be removed in the output grid.
Q5: Identify the role of the number 0 in the input grid. It seems to be preserved in the output grid.
Q6: Notice the pattern of the number 6 in the output grid. It seems to be placed in the same relative position as the number 9 in the input grid.
Q7: Apply these observations to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern of transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is always 3 rows. Determine the rule for selecting which rows from the input grid are used to form the output grid.
Q3: Identify the transformation of the numbers in the grid. In the examples, 9 changes to 6 and 4 changes to 0. Determine the rule for this transformation.
Q4: Apply the rules identified in Q2 and Q3 to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern of transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is always half the size of the input grid. Determine the rule for this transformation.
Q3: Identify the transformation of the color 9 in the input grid to the color 6 in the output grid.
Q4: Identify the transformation of the color 4 in the input grid to the color 0 in the output grid.
Q5: Determine the rule for the transformation of the colors in the input grid to the colors in the output grid.
Q6: Apply the rules determined in Q2 and Q5 to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
